cs.DS, cs.DM, cs.CC, cs.GT, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with the optimization problem of machine scheduling, which is a fundamental problem in computer science. The paper also introduces a variation of the problem that includes bag-constraints, which is a topic that falls under the category of discrete mathematics (cs.DM). The paper uses new insights and instance transformations to achieve an EPTAS, which is a topic that falls under the category of algorithms and complexity (cs.DS). The paper also deals with the concept of feasibility and constraints, which is a topic that falls under the category of computational complexity (cs.CC). The paper uses a PTAS as a starting point, which is a topic that falls under the category of game theory (cs.GT). Finally, the paper deals with approximation algorithms, which is a topic that falls under the category of machine learning (cs.LG).
